paper_abstract: The view of a node in a port-labeled network is an infinite tree encoding all walks in the network originating from this node. We prove that for any integers n >= D >= 1, there exists a port-labeled network with at most n nodes and diameter at most D which contains a pair of nodes whose (infinite) views are different, but whose views truncated to depth Omega(D log(n/D)) are identical. paper_title: Distinguishing views in symmetric networks: A tight lower bound
